content.description: Phoebe and Rachel’s new apartment, Rachel and Phoebe are making their answering machine message.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ready?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: it’s…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Rachel…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: and…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe’s…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: please…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: leave…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: leave…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wait, I-I just said “leave.”

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I know because you have all the good words. What do I get? I get “it’s,” “and” oh I’m sorry, I have “A.” Forget it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe, come on that’s silly.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, so let’s switch.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I have all of the good words. OK, fine, fine, we can switch.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Everybody…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Rachel…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: and…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe’s…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Please…wait, how did you do that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, you’re no ordinary roommate are you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe, come on can we finish this later? Cause I wanna go running before it gets dark. Oh! Why don’t you come with me?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, it’ll be fun. We’ll run in the park. It’ll be like our first y’know roommate bonding thing.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, let’s go running!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah and there’s really cute guys there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Let’s run towards them!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, wait just one more second. Hi, it’s Phoebe and Rachel’s. Please leave a message, thanks!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Now wait a minute. You just took all the words!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh. You’ve met your match Rachel Green.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s new apartment, Ross and Chandler are there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, I just finished this fascinating book. By the year 2030, there’ll be computers that can carry out the same amount of functions as an actual human brain. So theoretically you could download your thoughts and memories into this computer and-and-and live forever as a machine.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And I just realized I can sleep with my eyes open.
[Monica enters]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross and Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Honey, that’s a great idea nailing the boxes to the floor!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I didn’t nail the boxes to the floor.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, So you can move them!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, and while I’m doing that, Ross has a great computer story for you.
[Joey enters with his new roommate who is played by none other than Elle MacPherson.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey everybody! Uh, I’d like you to meet Janine. She’s-she’s gonna be my new roommate!

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi! (Rushes over to shake her hand instantly.)

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Hi

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, she’s gonna live with me!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s nice to meet you. Janine…?

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Lecroix. Janine Lecroix

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I didn’t know that! Well, what a pretty last name!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, uh, wh-where ya from?

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Australia, I just moved here a couple of weeks ago.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: From the land down under? I didn’t know that either!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So uh, wha-uh, what do you do?

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: I’m a dancer.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’re a dancer? She-she’s a dancer!

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Well, I think I’ll go and unpack.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, hey let me. (Opens the door for Janine and after he closes the door behind her gasps ecstatically.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, did you even interview this woman before you asked her to move in?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Of course I did.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh-huh, what exactly did you ask her?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: “When can you move in?”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you for bringing her into our lives.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Unbelievable

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, so you like her too Chandler?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, look at all the boxes!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ugh, I cannot wait to ask her out!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait a minute…Joey. Joey you can’t ask her out, she’s your roommate. It-it’ll be way too complicated.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, yeah man don’t do it. I mean if you date her, then-then-then I can’t date her.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, think about it. Now remember when you were going out with that girl Donna and you guys broke up. Remember how horrible it was when you guys bumped into each other at the supermarket?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh God, yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Now imagine you live at the supermarket.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, Oh, you’re right! I don’t want that. I can’t date her!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah and you better watch the flirting too, cause you know, in such close quarters, it could be trouble.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, that’s gonna be tough Mon. I mean it’s hard for me to be around an attractive woman and not flirt.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hmm, well you’re around me all the time and you don’t flirt.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You a little sad about that sweetheart?

content.description: [Scene, The Park: Phoebe and Rachel are getting ready to go running]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I have to tie my shoe, so you go ahead, I’ll catch up.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. (Runs off.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. (Starts running crazily with her arms flapping and her legs far apart) Come on! That’s not running! Let’s go! (Rachel pauses, then follows, embarrassed.)

content.description: [Scene, Central Perk: Rachel, Ross and Monica are there]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You guys, I’m telling you, when she runs, she looks like a cross between Kermit The Frog and The Six Million Dollar Man.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica had such a crush on him. Yeah, she used to kiss his poster every night before she went to bed.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! I used to do that too!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did you also have his album, It’s Not Easy Being Green ?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Aw, Mon…(Kisses her on the cheek)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, Phoebe runs weird huh?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, yeah and you know what, I know she’s gonna wanna run again, I just don’t know how to get out of it, I mean, I live with her.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why don’t you just be straight with her? Tell her the truth.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’re right, you’re right. I should just tell her the truth.
[Phoebe enters]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pheebs, Monica tripped me, I don’t think I can ever run again, ever!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why? Why would you do that?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know. Rachel I’m-I’m sorry that I hurt your ankles.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ankle.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’ll see.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s new apartment, Chandler is putting something away under the sink.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: OK, I’m officially unpacked. Thanks for helping me man. (Turns around and sees that Joey isn’t there.) Joe? (Hears giggling coming from a box) Well, I guess Joey went home. Oh and look, there’s still one box that I have to unpack. (Hears the giggling again)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I Gotcha!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God! You-almost-gave-me-a-heart-attack.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Boy, it was so hard not to laugh, I tell ya. Hey, hey, the place looks great!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, not bad right? You know what, Monica’s gonna be working late, so I’m gonna make this place spotless. You know what else I’m gonna do, know what else I’m gonna do? I’m gonna go downstairs, I’m gonna get her some flowers. Now who wouldn’t wanna live with me?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t! No, I wanna live with the super-hot Australian dancer.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, now how’s that going though? Are you okay with the not-flirting thing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. Well, so far yeah. But it’s tough you know? I got all this built up flirting energy and I don’t know how to get rid of it. (Gives Chandler the “Joey-love,” look.) How you doin?

content.description: [Scene Joey and Janine’s new apartment, Janine is there. Joey walks in to see Janine bent over, stretching.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ohhhh man

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Sorry, there’s just more room out here.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no-no-no-no, it’s-it’s uh, you just uh, uh reminded me that uh, I need to do my stretches too. (Starts to stretch, groans painfully)

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Why don’t you try to do-

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: What’s wrong?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh-uh nothing. I-I-I-I didn’t want you to touch me cause I’m -I’m all sweaty from the workout. I better hit the shower. (Goes into the bathroom and comes back out quickly) Oh my God!

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Oh, sorry about that stuff hanging in there. It’s just my thongs are too delicate for the dryer.
(Joey laughs nervously and goes to his bedroom.)

content.description: [Scene, The Park, Rachel is running and Phoebe is hiding behind a tree.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi! Oh yeah, uh-huh, it’s me. I saw you grab your running shoes this morning and sneak out. You lied so you could run by yourself.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, no Phoebe no, I was…no. You know what, I was, I was actually just checking to, see, if I could run. And I can!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Please Rachel, I am not an idiot. (Runs off)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, wait Phoebe.

content.description: [Scene, Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler is there. Everything is out of its place and Chandler’s cleaning.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow, couples who live together do start to look alike. So, Mondler…uh, what uh, what ‘cha doin?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What does it look like I’m doing? I am cleaning!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Did you get Monica’s authorization to move all of her stuff?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Authorization? I don’t need that. I’m gonna put everything back.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Put it back exactly where you found it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes I’m gonna put it back (Mocking Ross) exactly where I found it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: ‘Kay, first of all, this attitude is not helping.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She’s not gonna care if I put her stuff back in the same stupid place.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Whoa, hello, did you just meet Monica?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She is gonna recognize that I did a nice thing and-and, appreciate it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hmm -you know, actually this’ll work out well. Cause when you have to move back in with Joey, Joey’s hot new roommate can come and live with me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I see, I see, y-y-you’re trying to freak me out.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look Chandler, Monica is really weird about this kind stuff all right. Believe me, I lived with her for 16 years. She is going to freak…out. Oh my God, she’s going to sit on you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, she’s not okay? And I’ll prove it to you. I’m gonna call her right now. (Picks up the phone and wipes it off) Phone’s done ehh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey Mon, how’s it going?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Terrible. If-if I want something done right, I have to do it myself. Other people just wreck stuff. I really think I might kill someone tonight.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh come on, come on, it can’t be that bad.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s worse. The only thing that’s getting me through is knowing that I’m gonna be seeing you soon. I think I may even try to get out of here early.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No! No-no-no-no-no-no. It sounds like they really need you down there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, are you just hanging out with Ross?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s, all good! Okay bye-bye Mon! (To Ross) She’s-she’s gonna kill me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, the phone was facing the other way. (Chandler fixes it and a picture frame off the table.) And that goes back up there.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, continued from earlier.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We should start with the big stuff. Y’know? That’ll be the easiest. Uh, let’s start with the couch. (He picks up one end and Ross doesn’t help) I got it. (He moves it back to where he thinks it goes.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah that-that, doesn’t look right.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you talking about? The couch is perfectly in line with the carpet. And then I can just walk over here and casually just put my feet right up on the…(Tries to rest his feet on the coffee table but they won’t reach) OK, OK, here’s what we do, we just uh, move the couch closer to the coffee table.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Whoa, whoa, but then the back of the couch won’t line up with he back of the carpet.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: OK well here, we’ll just move the coffee table closer to the couch.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Whoa, Whoa, Whoa, but then the coffee table won’t be centered in the seating area.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, but the coffee table doesn’t match the…blahebdmsdlkhdyslkd;btyds…Rooosss!!!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, what am I gonna do? I’m not flirting but still, I’m drawing her to me like - like a moth to a flame! (Tries to put his feet on the coffee table…they won’t reach and looks around.) What the hell’s going on over here?!?!? (Points to Chandler) Monica’s gonna kill you! Look I need your help, I have to do something to-to repel this woman! Wait a minute, wait a minute, you guys repel women all the time.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, I’ve been married 3 times
(Chandler gives him a round of mock applause.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no-no I’ve seen it happen, you-you get a rapport going with a woman but somehow you manage to kill it. What’s your secret?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, we do not repel women OK? That is completely untrue.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no, yes we do my man. Remember when we were back in college and we went to that spring dance and you walked right up to that girl you liked and you could not stop talking about the Irish potato famine?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, well what about you? You weren’t you know, so hot in college either. After everything he said, he’d go “ba dum bum chessh”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, Monica doesn’t like that either, Maybe I should stop doing that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh y’know what, girls don’t like it when I start talking about science.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s not specific to girls.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This is great, this is great, what else, what else?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, they don’t like it when you correct their grammar.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And they don’t like it when you explain why your jokes are funny.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: They don’t like it when you keep asking them if they like you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Man, I’m so lucky I have Monica.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m never gonna find love again.

content.description: Phoebe and Rachel’s, Rachel is there as Phoebe enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey Phoebe, can I talk to you for a second?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sure

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, um, I…(Phoebe walks into her room.) All right Phoebe look, I just wanted to say that I’m sorry. OK? I handled the situation horribly and I should not have lied to you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So, what should you have done?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I-I should’ve told you the truth.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-Huh, Which is…?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, y’know, the reason I didn’t wanna go running with you is because um, well y’know the way that you run is a little…(Starts flapping her arms)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, it’s embarrassing. People were looking at us like we were crazy.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why do you care?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Because they’re people.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But people that you don’t know and will never see again.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, but still. They’re people…with eyes.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I didn’t get embarrassed running next to Miss (panting). But no, okay. No, no, I can see why running with me would be embarrassing to you. Yeah, okay. You’re uptight.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I-I am not uptight—Hey-hey-hey-oh-oh! Listen, I am not uptight, man.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s okay Rachel. I’m not judging you; that’s just who you are. Me. I’m more free y’know? I run like I did when I was a kid, cause that’s the only way it’s fun. Y’know, I mean didn’t you ever run so fast you thought your legs were gonna fall off? Y’know, like when you were like running towards the swings or running away from Satan? (Rachel looks confused) The neighbor’s dog.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler has the tape measure out and is busy lining up the lamp on the kitchen counter, Ross is supervising the whole operation.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, is this lamp in the same place?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Who cares? I repel women.
[Monica tries to come in]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no-no-no-no-no-no-no!!! You can’t come in here! R-r-r-r-Ross is naked.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I couldn’t say that I was naked because she’s allowed too see me naked.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why does anyone have to be naked?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why is Ross naked?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I-I had to show Chandler something?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Naked?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah-yeah I uh, I have a uh, a guy problem.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Is it the same thing that Chandler had?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, uh, just come later, we’ll get everything squared away and you can come back later.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, listen, there’s still some of Chandler’s medicine under the sink in the bathroom. Bye!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bye! Thank God

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dude, what’d you have?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, we have no time okay? We must focus. We gotta get everything back into its original place.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The photo album! There were millions of pictures of the apartment in the photo album. We just go through it and match everything to the pictures.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s perfect! That’s brilliant! (Starts going through the photo album)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So really, what’d ya have?

content.description: Joey and Janine’s, Janine’s there. Joey enters

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Hey Joey, I got some beer for you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, don’t you mean “for whom?”

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Sure, listen I was gonna order some pizza, you wanna share one?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pizza, heh, its not like I never had that before…ba dum bum cheshhh.

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Is there something wrong?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, All right, let’s just get this out in the open okay? You’re hot. I’m lovable. Clearly there’s a vibe going on between us. But, we’re roommates and it’s a huge mistake for us to continue down this road.

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Joey…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, no, no, I’m telling ya. Imagine yourself living in a supermarket and you will understand okay? So the question is, what do we do?

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Well, I don’t think there is anything to do. I mean I think you’re really sweet, but I’m just not interested in you like that.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh!

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: No! I mean you’re a really nice guy and I’m happy to be your roommate and your friend, I’m just y’know, I just don’t feel that way about you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh! I see what happened. It’s because I was trying to repel you. Right? Believe me, you’d feel a lot different if I turned it on.

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: I don’t think so.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I do. (Gives her the Joey-love look.) How you doin?

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: I’m OK

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?!?!

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh dear God!

content.description: The park, Rachel’s running by herself and panting. After a little while she decides to run like Phoebe.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh honey, I’m so sorry, you were right, this feels great!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: See? And you don’t care if people are staring, it’s just for a second cause then you’re gone!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Gone! I mean its amazing Pheebs. I feel so free and so graceful. (Turns and bumps into a mounted policeman and falls) Hey! Look out for the horse! Sorry! (Runs off.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler and Ross are there. Monica enters

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Is it okay for me to come in now?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh-huh

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why is everything different?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Bye! (Runs out)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, I don’t see anything different other than the fact that the room got so much brighter when you came into it. (Forced laughter)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, the end table is wrong, The couch looks bizarre and don’t even get me started on the refrigerator magnets.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay look, don’t…don’t be mad okay? But after I unpacked the boxes I wanted to do something nice for you, so, I-I-I cleaned the apartment. So I moved everything around and then I forgot where it, where it went back and I’m sorry, I’m very sorry, I’m sorry, I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s okay. Chandler, are you afraid of me or something?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do you want me to be afraid of you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Of course not. I mean gosh, Chandler what you did, it’s, it’s a wonderful thing and I really appreciate it. I know I have this weird thing where I want everything to be in the perfect place, but I’d never expect you to worry about that.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Of course!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh well you’re the best. You come here to me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, hold on okay? First thing’s first. (Gets her cleaning gloves on) Okay, now did Ross sit anywhere while he was naked?

content.description: Central Perk, Ross, Janine and Chandler are there

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So it said that by the year 2030, there’ll be computers that can carry out the same number of functions as an actual human brain. So theoretically we could download our thoughts and our memories into this computer…

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: …and live forever as a machine!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s so Janine, you-you-you know what, do you know we’re doing right now? You and I, we’re interfacing.

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: Yeah, I gotta go.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ba dum bumb cheshhh!
